issue.title: Allow to configure TTL of successful DNS queries

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Add an option to Connection options panel that allows to configure the
TTL of successful DNS queries (that is, GUI option for security property
"networkaddress.cache.ttl").

Fix #2742 - Allow for override/customization of Java's
"networkaddress.cache.ttl" value

body:
Reopening, in some cases (e.g. when starting with empty home dir) the option is not correctly applied.

From feedback received in the IRC channel.

issue.title: Document option DNS - TTL Successful Queries

repository.name: zap-core-help
repository.description: The help files for the ZAP core

issue.body:
Change "Options Connection screen" page to document the option TTL
Successful Queries under the DNS section.

Part of zaproxy/zaproxy#2742 - Allow for override/customization of
Java's "networkaddress.cache.ttl" value

body:
@thc202 - I spoke a bit with @psiinon this morning, and he thinks you might actually have what you need, setup-wise, from your end, to debug this further, when you get a chance?

Asking not to rush you into fixing this particular issue, but because our team is actively decommissioning unused infrastructure from a recent migration to AWS, including the server in which I still see this.

Is it OK if I go ahead and shut that host down, or do you still need it (and if so, for how long, do you think?)

Cheers!
Yeah, will check that this morning. Hopefully, just today/tomorrow. Thanks!

Closing as fixed in 2.6.0. Latest debug session showed that the option was being properly set and the DNS queries cached (although in some cases they were not used, exact cause is not yet known, as it happened in JRE classes).

issue.title: Add fixed issues to old release help pages

repository.name: zap-core-help
repository.description: The help files for the ZAP core

issue.body:
Add issue zaproxy/zaproxy#984 to 2.4.0 release page.
Add issue zaproxy/zaproxy#2742 to 2.6.0 release page.
